headline.0: Who's Extorting Whom? It's All About Coercion
headline.1: On Greece: Plus ça Change, Plus C'est la Même Chose

short_description.0: The Economist's Feb. 6 cover displayed the Venus de Milo statue pointing a revolver, with the headline "Go ahead, Angela, make my day." In the editors' upside-down world, Greece is threatening Europe, or at least Germany. Really?
short_description.1: People keep asking me what I think about Europe's most recent crisis (read: Greece). Well, my sentiments are exactly the same as they were in April 2012, when my Globe Asia column was titled: "China and Greece - Here We Go Again."

authors.0: Mark Weisbrot, ContributorCo-Director, Center for Economic and Policy Research, Washingt...
authors.1: Steve H. Hanke, ContributorProfessor of Applied Economics at The Johns Hopkins University...
